creditline: Gift of Elizabeth and Willard Clark in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts
description: large biomorphic red lacquer form; one rounded anatomical end; opposite end resembles samurai helmet with deep fluting that converges to inverted point
medium: Lacquer and hemp cloth on Styrofoam
signed: on bottom in black: Sasai Fumie Substantial Fruit 2014
text: Sasai spent about seven months completing this sculpture, a work commissioned in 2013 that was inspired by the seeds of Japanese horse chestnut trees. The piece conveys a sense of energy and strength with its blend of sharp lines and curved surfaces, both of which are enhanced by a glossy finish.
title: Substantial Fruit
